_source.content: Why Would They Lie About Flat Earth?  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CMzZrQc_eXI  When confronted with blatant NASA lies and obvious globe inconsistencies, the #1 most common frequently asked question is undoubtedly: but why would anyone lie about the shape of the Earth!? card.description: On September 9, the International Organization for Standardization (‚ÄúISO‚Äú) announced that it would create a new Merchant Category Code (‚ÄúMCC‚Äù) specific to firearm and ammunition retailers. MCCs are the codes that payment processing networks (like Visa, MasterCard, and American Express) use to categorize various transactions. This is the system that allows various credit cards to offer different benefits for certain categories of purchases or to charge different fees for those same categories.
card.title: NRA-ILA | New Credit Card Rule Creates Gun Registry

_source.content: #2ndAmendmentNew Credit Card Rule Creates Gun RegistryOn September 9, the International Organization for Standardization (‚ÄúISO‚Äú) announced that it would create a new Merchant Category Code (‚ÄúMCC‚Äù) specific to firearm and ammunition retailers. MCCs are the codes that payment processing networks (like Visa, MasterCard, and American Express) use to categorize various transactions. This is the system that allows various credit cards to offer different benefits for certain categories of purchases or to charge different fees for those same categories.In June, Amalgamated Bank petitioned the ISO to create a new firearm specific MCC. This was the second such petition after the ISO denied an identical petition last year. The petition was supported by, among others, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), New York Mayor Eric Adams, and the anti-gun groups Giffords and Guns Down America. The petition, at least initially, seemed to lack the support of Visa, MasterCard, and American Express.If fully implemented by the various payment processors, the hope of gun control groups for this new MCC is that it would create a registry of gun owners that they have long sought and provide them with another tool to attack lawful industry when firearms are used in crime.Several provisions in federal law, but most notably a key part of the Firearm Owners Protection Act of 1986, prohibit the federal government from centralizing most firearm records into a registry. The new MCC could provide a way for the government to outsource the creation of a registry that the government itself is prohibited from creating. If banks and payment processors share their records with the government, that would be a major step towards the registration of all gun owners in America.  More...https://www.nraila.org/articles/20220913/new-credit-card-rule-creates-gun-registry
_source.contentraw:
#2ndAmendment

New Credit Card Rule Creates Gun Registry

On September 9, the International Organization for Standardization (‚ÄúISO‚Äú) announced that it would create a new Merchant Category Code (‚ÄúMCC‚Äù) specific to firearm and ammunition retailers. MCCs are the codes that payment processing networks (like Visa, MasterCard, and American Express) use to categorize various transactions. This is the system that allows various credit cards to offer different benefits for certain categories of purchases or to charge different fees for those same categories.

In June, Amalgamated Bank petitioned the ISO to create a new firearm specific MCC. This was the second such petition after the ISO denied an identical petition last year. The petition was supported by, among others, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), New York Mayor Eric Adams, and the anti-gun groups Giffords and Guns Down America. The petition, at least initially, seemed to lack the support of Visa, MasterCard, and American Express.

If fully implemented by the various payment processors, the hope of gun control groups for this new MCC is that it would create a registry of gun owners that they have long sought and provide them with another tool to attack lawful industry when firearms are used in crime.

Several provisions in federal law, but most notably a key part of the Firearm Owners Protection Act of 1986, prohibit the federal government from centralizing most firearm records into a registry. The new MCC could provide a way for the government to outsource the creation of a registry that the government itself is prohibited from creating. If banks and payment processors share their records with the government, that would be a major step towards the registration of all gun owners in America. More...
https://www.nraila.org/articles/20220913/new-credit-card-rule-creates-gun-registry

_source.content: The For-Profit D.C. Firm Staging America‚Äôs ‚ÄòGrassroots‚Äô MovementsTablet Magazine ^ | September 13, 2022 | Hayden Ludwighttps://www.tabletmag.com/sections/news/articles/for-profit-dc-firm-staging-americas-grassroots-movements-arabella-advisorsBehind the closed doors of an unassuming philanthropic consultancy in Washington, D.C., is one of the most powerful lobbying forces in the United States. The Atlantic has called it ‚Äúthe massive progressive dark-money group you‚Äôve never heard of‚Äù and ‚Äúthe indisputable heavyweight of Democratic dark money.‚Äù The Washington Post believes its potent lobbying arm is reason enough for Congress to enact forced donor disclosure laws, while Politico labelled it a ‚Äúdark-money behemoth.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe system of political financing, which often obscures the identities of donors, is known as dark money,‚Äù wrote The New York Times, ‚Äúand Arabella‚Äôs network is a leading vehicle for it on the left.‚ÄùMeet Arabella Advisors, the brainchild of ex-Clinton administration staffer Eric Kessler and the favorite tool of anonymous, billionaire donors on the progressive left. Since 2006, the Arabella hub has overseen a growing network of nonprofits‚Äîcall them the ‚Äúspokes‚Äù‚Äîthat collected $2.4 billion in the 2019-20 election cycle, nearly twice as much as the Republican and Democratic national committees combined.These nonprofits in turn manage and supervise a vast array of ‚Äúpop-up‚Äù groups‚Äîmainly political attack-dog websites, ad campaigns, and ‚Äúspontaneous‚Äù demonstrations staffed by Arabella‚Äôs network of activist professionals who pose as members of independent activist organizations. These groups‚Äîsuch as Fix Our Senate, the Hub Project, and Floridians for a Fair Shake‚Äîtypically emerge very suddenly in order to savage the political opposition on the policy or outrage of that particular day or week, then vanish just as quickly. The pop-ups do not file IRS disclosures or report their budgets, boards, or staff. In most cases, their connection to Arabella goes unreported. Many of them have offered sympathetic ordinary voters the opportunity to donate to whatever the ‚Äúgrassroots‚Äù cause happens to be, when in fact the money feeds back into Arabella‚Äôs enormous dark-money network.

https://www.tabletmag.com/sections/news/articles/for-profit-dc-firm-staging-americas-grassroots-movements-arabella-advisors

Behind the closed doors of an unassuming philanthropic consultancy in Washington, D.C., is one of the most powerful lobbying forces in the United States. The Atlantic has called it ‚Äúthe massive progressive dark-money group you‚Äôve never heard of‚Äù and ‚Äúthe indisputable heavyweight of Democratic dark money.‚Äù The Washington Post believes its potent lobbying arm is reason enough for Congress to enact forced donor disclosure laws, while Politico labelled it a ‚Äúdark-money behemoth.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe system of political financing, which often obscures the identities of donors, is known as dark money,‚Äù wrote The New York Times, ‚Äúand Arabella‚Äôs network is a leading vehicle for it on the left.‚Äù

Meet Arabella Advisors, the brainchild of ex-Clinton administration staffer Eric Kessler and the favorite tool of anonymous, billionaire donors on the progressive left. Since 2006, the Arabella hub has overseen a growing network of nonprofits‚Äîcall them the ‚Äúspokes‚Äù‚Äîthat collected $2.4 billion in the 2019-20 election cycle, nearly twice as much as the Republican and Democratic national committees combined.

These nonprofits in turn manage and supervise a vast array of ‚Äúpop-up‚Äù groups‚Äîmainly political attack-dog websites, ad campaigns, and ‚Äúspontaneous‚Äù demonstrations staffed by Arabella‚Äôs network of activist professionals who pose as members of independent activist organizations. These groups‚Äîsuch as Fix Our Senate, the Hub Project, and Floridians for a Fair Shake‚Äîtypically emerge very suddenly in order to savage the political opposition on the policy or outrage of that particular day or week, then vanish just as quickly. The pop-ups do not file IRS disclosures or report their budgets, boards, or staff. In most cases, their connection to Arabella goes unreported. Many of them have offered sympathetic ordinary voters the opportunity to donate to whatever the ‚Äúgrassroots‚Äù cause happens to be, when in fact the money feeds back into Arabella‚Äôs enormous dark-money network.

group.description: Oligarchy is a term for a government in which power is held by a select few individuals or a small class of powerful people. This can mean that these few people are the actual leaders, or that they influence or control the decisions that the leaders make (that they're the ones "pulling the strings " behind the scenes).
group.title: Global Oligarchy

card.description: But the left doesn't believe in rights for Trump...
card.title: If You Don't Get Why Trump Pled the Fifth, Listen to the Remarks of the NY AG

_source.content: If You Don't Get Why Trump Pled the Fifth, Just Listen to the Remarks of the New York Attorney GeneralRed State ^ | 08/10/2022 | Nick Aramahttps://redstate.com/nick-arama/2022/08/10/if-you-dont-get-why-trump-pled-the-fifth-listen-to-the-remarks-of-the-ny-ag-n610336As we reported earlier, President Donald Trump invoked the Fifth Amendment when he was questioned during a deposition in New York on Wednesday in a civil case being pursued by New York Attorney General Letitia James.‚ÄúI once asked ‚Äòif you‚Äôre innocent, why are you taking the Fifth Amendment?‚Äô Now I know the answer to that question,‚Äù Trump said in a statement. ‚ÄúWhen your family, your company, and all the people in your orbit have become targets of an unfounded, politically motivated Witch Hunt supported by lawyers, prosecutors, and the Fake News Media, you have no choice.‚ÄùFolks on the left are already trying to spin that negatively against Trump. Even former prosecutor and lead impeachment counsel Daniel Goldman tweeted something that is just plain wrong. He should be ashamed he tweeted it and is misleading people who may not know better.The Fifth Amendment ensures that people are not forced to incriminate themselves.But you don‚Äôt take the Fifth if you didn‚Äôt do anything wrong. https://t.co/xIKupKNMSo‚Äî Daniel Goldman (@danielsgoldman) August 10, 2022There are reasons we have rights. Lawyers particularly should be respectful of that ‚Äî not putting down or denigrating the exercise of those rights or acting like taking the Fifth is a sign of guilt. Indeed, given all that has been leveled against Trump from multiple Democratic efforts, it is the intelligent and responsible way to proceed.If Goldman and others want to play that game, perhaps they‚Äôd like to explain why Hillary Clinton‚Äôs IT guy invoked the Fifth 125 times during the email investigation?Goldman is now running for Congress so perhaps he‚Äôs trying to appeal to the left with his tweet, but he‚Äôs just showing he has no principles with it.We‚Äôve seen it isn‚Äôt about guilt or innocence when it comes to Trump ‚Äî it‚Äôs about getting him out of the way. They went after him even before he got into office with the Russia probe, they were talking about trying to impeach him before he‚Äôd done anything as president. The FBI even had a lawyer who filed a false statement against the Trump team in an application for a FISA warrant. We‚Äôve now also seen the completely unprecedented move by the FBI, to raid Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago home.Trump would be foolish if he didn‚Äôt invoke the Fifth. It‚Äôs particularly wise in this case, given that James campaigned on the promise to get Trump. Pursuing the man, not any specific crime ‚Äî a truly concerning approach.Eric Trump, Donald Trump‚Äôs son, posted an ad with some of the statements that James has made about Trump in the past.It‚Äôs all coordinated! http://pic.twitter.com/7EsXAZICtx‚Äî Eric Trump (@EricTrump) August 10, 2022Why would you expect to get any kind of objectivity or fairness from someone who acts that way? Not to mention that‚Äôs wrong too when you‚Äôre supposed to be an objective attorney general.
_source.contentraw:
If You Don't Get Why Trump Pled the Fifth, Just Listen to the Remarks of the New York Attorney General
Red State ^ | 08/10/2022 | Nick Arama
https://redstate.com/nick-arama/2022/08/10/if-you-dont-get-why-trump-pled-the-fifth-listen-to-the-remarks-of-the-ny-ag-n610336

As we reported earlier, President Donald Trump invoked the Fifth Amendment when he was questioned during a deposition in New York on Wednesday in a civil case being pursued by New York Attorney General Letitia James.

‚ÄúI once asked ‚Äòif you‚Äôre innocent, why are you taking the Fifth Amendment?‚Äô Now I know the answer to that question,‚Äù Trump said in a statement. ‚ÄúWhen your family, your company, and all the people in your orbit have become targets of an unfounded, politically motivated Witch Hunt supported by lawyers, prosecutors, and the Fake News Media, you have no choice.‚Äù

Folks on the left are already trying to spin that negatively against Trump. Even former prosecutor and lead impeachment counsel Daniel Goldman tweeted something that is just plain wrong. He should be ashamed he tweeted it and is misleading people who may not know better.

The Fifth Amendment ensures that people are not forced to incriminate themselves.

But you don‚Äôt take the Fifth if you didn‚Äôt do anything wrong. https://t.co/xIKupKNMSo

‚Äî Daniel Goldman (@danielsgoldman) August 10, 2022

There are reasons we have rights. Lawyers particularly should be respectful of that ‚Äî not putting down or denigrating the exercise of those rights or acting like taking the Fifth is a sign of guilt. Indeed, given all that has been leveled against Trump from multiple Democratic efforts, it is the intelligent and responsible way to proceed.

If Goldman and others want to play that game, perhaps they‚Äôd like to explain why Hillary Clinton‚Äôs IT guy invoked the Fifth 125 times during the email investigation?

Goldman is now running for Congress so perhaps he‚Äôs trying to appeal to the left with his tweet, but he‚Äôs just showing he has no principles with it.

We‚Äôve seen it isn‚Äôt about guilt or innocence when it comes to Trump ‚Äî it‚Äôs about getting him out of the way. They went after him even before he got into office with the Russia probe, they were talking about trying to impeach him before he‚Äôd done anything as president. The FBI even had a lawyer who filed a false statement against the Trump team in an application for a FISA warrant. We‚Äôve now also seen the completely unprecedented move by the FBI, to raid Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago home.

Trump would be foolish if he didn‚Äôt invoke the Fifth. It‚Äôs particularly wise in this case, given that James campaigned on the promise to get Trump. Pursuing the man, not any specific crime ‚Äî a truly concerning approach.

Eric Trump, Donald Trump‚Äôs son, posted an ad with some of the statements that James has made about Trump in the past.

It‚Äôs all coordinated! http://pic.twitter.com/7EsXAZICtx

‚Äî Eric Trump (@EricTrump) August 10, 2022

Why would you expect to get any kind of objectivity or fairness from someone who acts that way? Not to mention that‚Äôs wrong too when you‚Äôre supposed to be an objective attorney general.

numbers by collapsing". No, the NIH still does NOT advise using ivermectin to treat Covid-19 except in clinical trials. The NIH is years behind the data and efficacy, and thousands have died because of it.

SCOTUS had a remarkable early 2022‚ùó WHO is the SCOTUS leaker‚ùì WE have not forgotten this matter.
